answerText: Tertiary Structure[10] Proteins that assist in the folding of proteins are these, so named because they keep the protein chain from perturbing outside influences so that it can fold.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Maryland A and Ohio State A | 8 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer the following about protein folding, for ten points each: [10] This is the name for the three dimensional shape of the protein, a step above the simple sequence or whether the protein locally conforms to an alpha helix or beta sheet.
